message:
On May 23, Microchip and its design partner, Digilent, will announce the first Arduino-compatible 32-bit microcontroller development platform. 
 
We’re holding a Virtual Press Conference to discuss this on May 18 @ 8 a.m. PDT.  Would alphaonelabs like to attend and receive a board(s) to play with?
Let me know if you are attending and how many boards you think they should ship us

Attendee Link:
 
When: Wednesday, May 18, 2011 8:00 AM (MST)
 
https://www.livemeeting.com/cc/microchiptechnology/join?id=B2CKFM&role=attend&pw=X%40.%3B%2B4F%22f
 
Meeting time: May 18, 2011 8:00 AM (MST) 
 
Add to my Outlook Calendar:
https://www.livemeeting.com/cc/microchiptechnology/meetingICS?id=B2CKFM&role=attend&pw=X%40.%3B%2B4F%22f&i=i.ics
 
AUDIO INFORMATION
-Telephone conferencing
 Use the information below to connect:
        Toll-free:            +1 (888) 424-8151
        Toll:                 +1 (847) 585-4422
        Participant code:     8085844
 
 
FIRST-TIME USERS
To save time before the meeting, check your system to make sure it is
ready to use Microsoft Office Live Meeting.
http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=90703
 
TROUBLESHOOTING
Unable to join the meeting? Follow these steps:
  1. Copy this address and paste it into your web browser:
     https://www.livemeeting.com/cc/microchiptechnology/join
  2. Copy and paste the required information:
        Meeting ID: B2CKFM
        Entry Code: X@.;+4F"f
        Location: https://www.livemeeting.com/cc/microchiptechnology
If you still cannot enter the meeting, contact support:
http://r.office.microsoft.com/r/rlidLiveMeeting?p1=12&p2=en_US&p3=LMInfo&p4=support
 
NOTICE
Microsoft Office Live Meeting can be used to record meetings.
By participating in this meeting, you agree that your communications
may be monitored or recorded at any time during the meeting.
free boards you say? count me in
Cool, I asked for 36 :)
Yay!
Oh thanks!  Yes the 18th.  Cool I'll join in then.

What does a 32bit compatible Arduino even mean?  Is it super-fast but still programmable via AVR?  Does it have a forest of I/O pins?  Sidenote, it is pretty much impossible to google the company "Microchip."  Haha.
Tomorrow?  Check your dates?  I think it's the 18th?
Ok so is everyone who responded game to make the seminar tomorrow morning?  I need to tell her.
Sh#t, I have work
Is this webcast PDT or MST? Anyone know?
OK It is at 11AM EST.
I am in the conference.
I'm not having any luck with the web client. :\
Awesome!  I'm glad you guys made it, how was it?  Sorry I couldn't make it.  Did they talk about releases or us becoming a reseller at all?
I SO want to play with one of these! Who wants to play with me?

I'll be at the Lab in the afternoon (3ish?) - I got it working with the provided IDE, and want to play with porting http://code.google.com/p/python-on-a-chip/ - someone has already started porting from the pic24 to the pic32
Wish I had the foggiest idea what it means.... I plan to be there later this pm as well.
maybe closer to 4 - washers busy, had to serialize laundry
Yah. Gonna wait out what looks like a sudden shower approaching...
Almost there
Going to fireplace restaurant
Going to head there closer to 18:00
Hey Mick, not raining - want to head to the Lab?
Not raining? I checked camera, thought you'd left. How long will you be there?
I'm going there now.

Got the ethernet shield working - had to use software SPI.  Download my source from git://github.com/rmd6502/chipKIT32-MAX.git .  I just copied the hardware libraries over the ones in the IDE, but you can build the IDE too.
Note that the repo I forked from has had bug fixes applied, so you might want to download the latest IDE, then copy over the hardware/pic32/libraries/Ethernet and SoftSPI directories from my repo
Thinking I'll port elua to the chip32 then use kepler for the web framework
Awesome
